The terror attacks of September 11th, 2001, are viewed by many in several different ways. For our students, it's a history lesson, a lesson that they see and hear about on TV, social media, and even in their homes. For our educators, some were sitting in classrooms as students, while others were young teachers trying to navigate the horrific news of that day.

Wherever you were or however you recall that day, let us remember the importance of honoring the fallen, as well as recognizing the lessons learned from that day. We are stronger as a community and nation when we choose to honor, love, and respect our fellow citizens. #NeverForget

This afternoon a number of executive orders were released that impact high school athletics. As a member of the MHSAA, we plan to continue to implement the safety protocols that have been developed for Fall Athletics and all sports. We continue to work with the SEC Athletic Conference to schedule and work with the Lenawee County Health Department to ensure student and fan safety.

Thanks to all who have supported Maple Athletics and our student athletes as they prepare for the season of a lifetime. Our coaches are to be commended for their care and passion. Our Marching Band Students and their Directors are ready to go and show their Maple Pride!!!

In the coming days we will release more information on guidelines and expectations.

Until then, please be safe this weekend so all Maples can participate to the fullest extent possible and we can safely return to school for a great start.

Be safe and Go Maples!!!
Bob Behnke
Superintendent

Virtual 4-H Spartan Coding Camp campers will enjoy experiences such as:

Developing your own tech ideas; designing and coding an application from scratch; and attracting users to your product!
Learning the fundamentals of launching a product.

Discovering the essentials of web design and development.
Practicing coding skills in HTML, CSS, JS, Ruby, Rails and Github.

Enhancing your passion for technology and growing real-world skills.

Exploring career opportunities available at MSU!

After the camp is over, you will continue to learn and practice at your own pace with nearly 60 hours of self-paced online lessons that allow you to further hone your coding skills. 4-H Spartan Coding Camp is offered in collaboration with CodeNow.

Check out the website for additional details: https://www.canr.msu.edu/4-h-spartan-coding-camp/index

Today is National Administrative Professionals Day, and I would like to personally recognize some fantastic people who are vital to the success of the Recreation Department. Mrs. Hayes at Prairie, Mrs. Richard at Lincoln, Mrs. Rodocker at Michener, Mrs. Schefka at Alexander, as well as Mrs. Moore from the High School Athletic Office.

The success the Recreation Department has experienced in our short year and a half of existence is due to their hard work and support, and I could not do it without them.

So, on behalf of Adrian Public Schools, the Adrian Community Recreation Department, and the students and families of APS, thank you for all you do in helping to provide our students with an exciting and high-quality educational experience.

Jeremiah Davies
